articles.headline: Don Lemon Ousted From CNN in Move That Left Him ‘Stunned’
articles.snippet: Mr. Lemon, one of the network’s most recognizable stars, had been under scrutiny since an uproar over on-air remarks he made about women and aging in February.
articles.abstract: Mr. Lemon, one of the network’s most recognizable stars, had been under scrutiny since an uproar over on-air remarks he made about women and aging in February.
articles.lead_paragraph: Don Lemon is out at CNN.
articles.byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum, John Koblin and Benjamin Mullin

articles.headline: First Republic Bank Lost $102 Billion in Customer Deposits
articles.snippet: The regional bank received a $30 billion lifeline from big banks last month, but depositors and investors remain worried about its prospects.
articles.abstract: The regional bank received a $30 billion lifeline from big banks last month, but depositors and investors remain worried about its prospects.
articles.lead_paragraph: First Republic Bank, the most imperiled U.S. lender after last month’s banking crisis, on Monday disclosed the grisly details of just how troubled its business has become — and not much else.
articles.byline: By Maureen Farrell and Rob Copeland

articles.headline: Bed Bath & Beyond Shoppers Rush to Use All Those Coupons
articles.snippet: The retailer is closing its stores, leaving many longtime customers scrambling to make sure they get their goods — at a discount.
articles.abstract: The retailer is closing its stores, leaving many longtime customers scrambling to make sure they get their goods — at a discount.
articles.lead_paragraph: For many shoppers, Bed Bath & Beyond’s bankruptcy filing on Sunday was a call to action.
articles.byline: By Jordyn Holman, Lora Kelley and Lauren Hirsch

articles.headline: Ukraine’s Spring Offensive Comes With Immense Stakes for Future of the War
articles.snippet: Without a decisive victory, Western support for Ukraine could weaken, and Kyiv could come under increasing pressure to enter serious peace talks to end or freeze the conflict.
articles.abstract: Without a decisive victory, Western support for Ukraine could weaken, and Kyiv could come under increasing pressure to enter serious peace talks to end or freeze the conflict.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Ukraine is preparing to launch a counteroffensive against Russian forces as early as next month, American officials say, in the face of immense risks: Without a decisive victory, Western support for Ukraine could weaken, and Kyiv could come under increasing pressure to enter serious negotiations to end or freeze the conflict.
articles.byline: By Julian E. Barnes, Eric Schmitt, Adam Entous and Thomas Gibbons-Neff

articles.headline: What Tucker Carlson Leaves Behind as He Is Shown the Door
articles.snippet: The host’s abrupt dismissal upends Fox News’s prime-time lineup — and the carefully honed impression that the ratings star was all but untouchable.
articles.abstract: The host’s abrupt dismissal upends Fox News’s prime-time lineup — and the carefully honed impression that the ratings star was all but untouchable.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the days after the 2020 election, the Fox host Tucker Carlson sent an anxious text message to one of his producers. Fox viewers were furious about the network’s decision to call Arizona for Joseph R. Biden Jr.

articles.headline: Angry Farmers Pierce Europe’s United Front on Ukraine
articles.snippet: A grain deal that got Ukrainian exports moving and eased a global food crisis is now fueling protests in Romania and among other staunch supporters of Kyiv.
articles.abstract: A grain deal that got Ukrainian exports moving and eased a global food crisis is now fueling protests in Romania and among other staunch supporters of Kyiv.
articles.lead_paragraph: After more than a year of surprisingly solid European unity in support of Ukraine, grains of discord are piling up in the barn of Robert Vieru, a Romanian farmer with 500 tons of wheat and 250 tons of sunflower seeds now sitting unsold because of cut-price Ukrainian competition.

articles.headline: As Carlson and Lemon Exit, a Chapter Closes on Cable’s Trump War
articles.snippet: The two hosts took very different approaches, but the decisions by Fox News and CNN to shed the stars mark at least a temporary shift in the excesses of Trump-era coverage.
articles.abstract: The two hosts took very different approaches, but the decisions by Fox News and CNN to shed the stars mark at least a temporary shift in the excesses of Trump-era coverage.
articles.lead_paragraph: They were on very different networks and did very different things to draw very different ratings.

articles.headline: Commerce Dept. Outlines Plans to Fund Cutting-Edge Chip Research
articles.snippet: The Biden administration announced its strategy for the National Semiconductor Technology Center, a string of facilities aimed at propelling U.S. innovation.
articles.abstract: The Biden administration announced its strategy for the National Semiconductor Technology Center, a string of facilities aimed at propelling U.S. innovation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Biden administration outlined plans on Tuesday to propel research on the type of cutting-edge microchips needed to power computers, cars and other devices, saying it would establish a new national organization with locations in various parts of the United States.
articles.byline: By Ana Swanson and Don Clark

articles.headline: Biden Announces Re-election Bid, Defying Trump and History
articles.snippet: While the president once pitched himself as “a bridge” to a new generation of Democratic leaders, he has decided that he is not ready to turn the torch over yet.
articles.abstract: While the president once pitched himself as “a bridge” to a new generation of Democratic leaders, he has decided that he is not ready to turn the torch over yet.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden formally announced on Tuesday that he would seek a second term, arguing that American democracy still faces a profound threat from former President Donald J. Trump as he set up the possibility of a climactic rematch between the two next year.

articles.headline: Analysis: Biden Faces Headwinds, but Democrats See Reasons for Optimism
articles.snippet: President Biden’s poll numbers remain low, but structural advantages have Democrats insisting he is far better positioned than his Republican rivals.
articles.abstract: President Biden’s poll numbers remain low, but structural advantages have Democrats insisting he is far better positioned than his Republican rivals.
articles.lead_paragraph: Nearly seven in 10 Americans believe their country is on a “wrong track.” The incumbent president will be 81 on Election Day 2024. More than half of the voters in his own party don’t want him to run for re-election.
